alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued July 02 at 1:43PM PDT until July 02 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Sea surface temperatures are in the lower to mid 50s, 1F to 2F cooler than July normal sea surface temperatures. Unprepared beachgoers may get cold water shock if they are not used to these conditions. Although the rip current risks are not higher than normal, the beaches may be more crowded due to the holiday weekend and we encourage people to look out for each other in case someone is in distress. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast Counties. * WHEN...This morning through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Possible dangers to swimmers, surfers, and anyone standing or walking in or close to the water.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
